chapter.title: Migration Process
chapter.para: In this chapter you can find concise description of JBoss Developer Studio migration from 2.1.0 to 3.0.0 version.

section.title: How to migrate from 2.1 to 3.0.0 JBoss Developer Studio
section.para: To migrate from 2.1 to 3.0.0 you have to install a fresh JBDS 3.0.0 and go through all the steps of installation process that is fully described in Getting Started with JBoss Developer Studio guide.
Now you can not update your JBDS 2.X to 3.0.0 using update site (https://devstudio.jboss.com/updates/3.0/ ), as it was available in previous versions:
The reason is that JBDS 3.0 uses Eclipse 3.5, whereas JBDS 2.x uses Eclipse 3.4. Because of this platform change, a full installation is required to migrate.

When the installation process is complete you can point your JBDS 3.0.0 at your old workspace directory and continue working with your projects created using previous JBDS/Tools versions, or create a new one and import old projects into the new workspace.

note.title: Note:
note.para: In JBDS 3.0.0 Linux users no longer need to install the library libstdc+.so.5 on their mashines. Now this library is not required and can be removed from the system.
